turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I need new shoes, but I have no idea where to start. I'm open to suggestions but I really don't know what's in style right now. Any advice?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Sure! To give you the best recommendations, what kind of styles do you typically wear? Do you have a preference for casual, formal, athletic, etc.?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, I'd say mostly casual, but I need something that can be dressed up a bit. I have a lot of jeans and sometimes wear chinos. Nothing too flashy. I'm so bad at this, honestly.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, for a versatile style that works with jeans and chinos, I'd recommend looking into leather sneakers, like classic Adidas Stan Smiths or Common Projects Achilles. They're clean, stylish, and work for a range of situations. Alternatively, you could look at some minimalist leather boots, like Chelsea boots.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Those are good suggestions, thanks. But what about brands and pricing? I don't want to spend a fortune, but I want something that will last. Is there a way to know how a shoe will last before buying it?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a great question! Unfortunately, predicting the exact lifespan of a shoe is tricky. However, you can look at the materials used (full-grain leather is generally more durable than synthetic), and read reviews to gauge the experiences of other buyers. For brands, Adidas and similar are generally budget-friendly, while Common Projects are higher-end. Brands like Thursday Boots are a popular middle ground, known for quality at a reasonable price. I would recommend checking out reviews on those brands to see if those shoes are the right fit for you.
